core.supervisor_view package¶

Submodules¶

core.supervisor_view.supervisor_view module¶

class core.supervisor_view.supervisor_view.AddAgentView(**kwargs)¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.mixins.LoginRequiredMixin, django.views.generic.base.View

AddAgentView is responsible for adding agents to the employee and roster table. Here a supervisor can add the agent as an employee to the payroll tool.

get(req)¶

This method displays a form which can be used to create the user.

post(req)¶

This method saves the user information send from the above get method. It fetches firstname, last name, client, joining_date, zipwire, lob, password, password_repeat, supervisor and deluxe_code from the form and creates an instance of Roster and Employee type to save the data. if passwords don’t match a message is sent back to the page else Agent created is shown.

template_name = 'register.html'¶
class core.supervisor_view.supervisor_view.DowntimeProcessView(**kwargs)¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.mixins.LoginRequiredMixin, django.views.generic.base.View

This is responsible for showing the downtime values from the payroll table and here supervisor can approve the downtime for auxes like lunch break, not ready etc. This data is auto fetched from the payroll table so no manual requests were shown.

get(req)¶

This method calls a SP in the database end which gets all the downtime values from the table and shows it in a tabular format which can be used to approve or decline by the supervisors or TL’s in the org.

post(req)¶

This method basically fetches the action and tracker id for downtime. If action is YES it approves the downtime and if NO then the downtime is declined.

temaplate_name = 'downtime_index.html'¶
title = ''¶
class core.supervisor_view.supervisor_view.DowntimeTrackerView(**kwargs)¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.mixins.LoginRequiredMixin, django.views.generic.base.View

It is responsible for adding the downtime time for agents when they were engaged in other activities by supervisors. Here a form is presented in which agents can be selected from a list, date can be selected, and reason is given by the supervisor.

get(req)¶

This method is responsible to show the downtime tracker form. It renders the form-standard.html file in templates dir.

post(req)¶

This method takes date, agents name list and time, aux code and remarks from supervisors end and saves it to the database, then redirects the user to downtime tracker view again.

template_name = 'form-standard.html'¶
title = 'Supervisor|D-Tracker'¶
class core.supervisor_view.supervisor_view.PayrollApprovedView(**kwargs)¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.mixins.LoginRequiredMixin, django.views.generic.base.View

get(req)¶
template_name = 'agent_payroll_approve.html'¶
class core.supervisor_view.supervisor_view.PayrollNotApprovedView(**kwargs)¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.mixins.LoginRequiredMixin, django.views.generic.base.View

This is responsible for showing all the agents who have not approved the payroll in last 3 days from the current date. It shows the payroll created date along with name of agent in a tabular format.

get(req)¶
template_name = 'agent_payroll_not_approved.html'¶
class core.supervisor_view.supervisor_view.SupervisorDisputeView(**kwargs)¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.mixins.LoginRequiredMixin, django.views.generic.base.View

get(req)¶

This displays all the disputes raised by agents in a tabular form along with filters which can use used to filter out the dipsutes as per the date. It only works for the employee’s whose role is TEAM_SUP, other than that everyone is redirected to login page.

post(req)¶

This method takes care of the events related to approve a dispute or decline it. If action is YES, the dipsute id which we fetch from the view is used and that dispute record is updated accordingly. Else if NO is there, dispute status is updated and NO is added to it. After this the page is redirected to dipsute view again.

template_name = 'payroll-super.html'¶
title = 'Supervisor|Payroll Logs'¶
class core.supervisor_view.supervisor_view.SupervisorView(**kwargs)¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.mixins.LoginRequiredMixin, django.views.generic.base.View

This basically display all the metrics like total agents, approved disputes, raised dispute, declined disputes in a card on the html page.

get(req)¶
template_name = 'dashboard_v3.html'¶
